title: clones of NEUE HELVETICA - EXTENDED BLACK?
content:
Hi there,

we are currently designing a logo and are in the hunt of the right font.

You know when you try to identify a font and declare it as HELVETICA  
but seconds later you realize: hey that’s not HELVETICA, that’s.....

Well. These are the fonts we are searching for. Please see the following image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202190426im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Screenshot_1_3646.jpg)

We are searching for a good and “rare” clone of the “NEUE HELVETICA EXTENDED BLACK”

Please no UNIVERS ,)

Thanks for your help! Best, Flo.

 [‹ 1950s text face](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202190426/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37107 "Go to previous forum topic") [More super than super ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202190426/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37172 "Go to next forum topic")
author: flinhardt

comments.content: Well, I don’t know if it’s of any help, but the FontFeed article [Helvetica and Alternatives to Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202190426/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/helvetica-and-alternatives-to-helvetica/) comes to mind. Thought I’d just mention it.
Very good shot! Thank you Quincunx!
